definition: lit. to squeeze out toothpaste/fig. to extract a confession under pressure
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
tooth/ivory/CL:顆|颗[ke1]
ointment/paste/CL:帖[tie3]
to moisten/to grease/to apply (cream, ointment)/to dip a brush in ink

sentences.english: He always squeezes toothpaste in the middle of the tube and makes a big noise when eating.
sentences.chinese: 他總是從中間開始擠牙膏，而且喫飯的時候吧唧嘴。

sentences.english: Mickey:Okay. Do you squeeze the toothpaste from the top or the bottom?
sentences.chinese: 好的，那你擠牙膏的時候是從上面還是下面？

sentences.english: Invoid of cumbersome procedure of getting out toothpaste, convenient for anybody.
sentences.chinese: 避免繁瑣的擠牙膏過程，適合大衆便於使用。

sentences.english: The toothpaste squeezing clamp body can be made into a cylinder or a rectangle.
sentences.chinese: 擠牙膏夾本體，可製成圓柱體或長方體。

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
fur
a short time/a little while
to undress
brains

reckless/extremely daring
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
needlework/sewing
to return something to its rightful owner

(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to whisper to one another's ear
